answers.author: Roderick Wood
answers.text:
I find the forms that are generic one page that you fill out for each position useless. I also don't like the overall ratings which usually ends up as an  average of the individual category.  An employee has to be competent in all categories. if they are an account and they are great in every category except they can't add or subtract, how can the overall be satisfactory if they can't do the job.  These forms do not help the employee understand what or how to fix any problem areas which is supposed to be the primary purpose of the evaluation.
While in Beverly Hills we developed an job performance for for each classification, broke it into major categories, no over all rating, you have to be sufficient in each category.  The supervisor was required with each evaluation to provide training guidance even when improvement was not needed.  The goal was not to just note short comings but to help prepare every employee for their next promotion.  The process should result in better employees that feel they are treated fair and feel they are be provided with opportunities to advance.
I am sure if you contacted the City of Beverly Hills they would be happy to share the program and process with you.
